articles.title: Kim Il Sung Prize Awarded to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Prize Awarded to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il was awarded Kim Il Sung Prize on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 A decree on awarding the prize was released on Mar. 29 by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK.
					
					 The SPA Presidium said in its decree that reflecting the unanimous will and desire of all the service personnel and people, it decided to confer the prize on Kim Jong Il who indicated the road for the Korean revolution and the times to follow with his encyclopedic ideas and theories and ushered in a shining heyday of building socialist culture in Songun Korea.

articles.title: Order of Kim Il Sung Awarded to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Order of Kim Il Sung Awarded to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Il Sung was awarded to general secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on conferring the order was promulgated on March 29.
					
					 The Presidium of the SPA in its decree said that reflecting the unanimous will and desire of all the service personnel and people, it awards Order of Kim Il Sung to Kim Jong Il who glorified the 100-year history of the sun's nation with victory and glory and laid an eternal foundation for the prosperity of Songun Korea by steadily advancing the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Delegates to 4th WPK Conference Arrive in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Delegates to 4th WPK Conference Arrive in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the 4th Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea arrived here today.
					 They were greeted by officials of the preparatory committee of the conference at Pyongyang Railway Station.

articles.title: Receives Congratulatory Letter from Egyptian Party Leader
articles.content:
Receives Congratulatory Letter from Egyptian Party Leader 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory letter from Hilmi Ahmad Salim, chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, in celebration of the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The letter was conveyed to an official concerned on Monday by Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chairman of the Committee for External Relations of the party, on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Meanwhile, Yehia Zakaria Khairullah presented a gift to Kim Jong Un on the same occasion.

articles.title: Gift from Young Communist League of Russia
articles.content:
Gift from Young Communist League of Russia 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Central Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned on Monday by Anatoli Dolgachev, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the league, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Visits Electronic and Technological Product Research Institute
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Visits Electronic and Technological Product Research Institute
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on Sunday learned about work at the Electronic and Technological Product Research Institute on the spot.
					 The institute succeeded in manufacturing a cutting-edge welder by intensifying its researches to mark the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung with big scientific and technological achievements.
					
					 The new type direct current welder is very efficient, though low in production cost and load. It has been introduced into various fields of the national economy including the construction site of Tanchon Port. It is popular for its advantages.
					
					 The premier learned about the production of the welder, its power efficiency, etc., and met meritorious scientists and technicians and congratulated them on their success.
					
					 He underscored the need for all scientists and technicians to uphold the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un with laudable sci-tech achievements, saying only when they push back the frontiers of latest science and technology is it possible to accelerate the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 He acquainted himself with the institute's production of LED lamps.

articles.title: S. Koreans Urged to Punish Lee Myung Bak Regime, "Saenuri Party"
articles.content:
S. Koreans Urged to Punish Lee Myung Bak Regime, "Saenuri Party" 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the National Reconciliation Council Monday issued an appeal to the south Korean people from all walks of life with the approach of the "National Assembly" election in south Korea. 
					 The upcoming "general election" will serve as a crucial watershed of the event in which the pro-U.S., pro-war conservative regime is allowed to stay longer or it is blocked and south Korea will head for independence, democracy and reunification, not an issue of which of the ruling and opposition parties takes more seats of the NA, the appeal said, and went on:
					
					 During their office the Lee Myung Bak regime and the "Saenuri Party" aligned with it committed thrice-cursed great treason against the south Korean people and all other Koreans. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak-Park Geun Hye group, driven into a tight corner, forsaken by the people and condemned by all the Koreans, is making desperate efforts to prolong the remaining days of the pro-U.S. conservative regime by escaping its shameful defeats in the "general election" and the "presidential" election this year. 
					
					 It is kicking up an anti-DPRK confrontation racket and recklessly cooking up the "north wind" to divert elsewhere public criticism of it and calm down the voices demanding "the punishment" of it and thus turn the situation before the elections in its favor.
					
					 "Revamp", "discrimination" and "five-point promise for family happiness" being touted by Park Geun Hye keen to call back the departed soul of "yusin" and the "Saenuri Party" are nothing but a cunning trick to evade the responsibility for the crimes she committed together with the Lee group by driving the north-south relations into a collapse and violating democracy and human rights and bringing people's living into destitution and gain popularity.
					
					 The south Korean people, the biggest victims of the unpopular rule of traitor Lee Myung Bak and Park's "Saenuri Party" ill-famed for sycophancy and treachery and confrontation with compatriots, should give full vent to their pent-up grudge and anger and inflict a devastating defeat upon the group of traitors in the "general election". 
					
					 Differing political view, religious faith and political affiliation do not matter in judging the group and there can be no distinction among classes and strata in doing so.
					
					 If a war breaks out in this land, it is none other than south Korea which will suffer the severest disaster. 
					
					 At the crossroads of peace and war, democracy and fascism, the compatriots in south Korea should cast ballots for peace and democracy and thus deal a heavy blow at the pro-U.S. warlike forces. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime precisely means the "Saenuri Party" and any ballot for the "Saenuri Party" means one for war, division and "yusin". 
					
					 The compatriots in south Korea desirous of independence and democracy against confrontation and war should sternly punish the group of traitors by casting every ballot in the "general election" in a responsible manner and thus usher in a new era of independence, democracy and reunification.

articles.title: KSC Calls for Judging Lee Myung Bak Regime and "Saenuri Party"
articles.content:
KSC Calls for Judging Lee Myung Bak Regime and "Saenuri Party"
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Korean Student Committee (KSC) Monday sent a letter to the youth and students in south Korea in which it called for judging the Lee Myung Bak regime and the "Saenuri Party" in the "general election".
					 The letter recalled that the Lee regime and the party have brought all sorts of misfortunes and disasters to the south Korean people.
					
					  It continued:
					
					 The south Korean youth and students are suffering more than any others due to the deterioration of the people's living resulting from serious joblessness, snowballing registration fees, sky-rocketing commodity prices, etc.
					
					 Democracy once won through a bloody struggle for several decades was wantonly violated, the people's rights ruthlessly trampled down and they are groaning in distress. Such reality in south Korea calls on the youth to display resolution and courage to hew out their destiny by their own efforts.
					
					 Whoever hates injustice and loves justice should respond to the above-said call with practice.
					
					 It is a solemn order of the era and necessity of history to judge the regime of traitors and bury it for democratic reforms, new things and those people who account for 99 percent of the population.
					
					 The south Korean youth and students should come out as one in the polling stations for judging the regime for which they had been waiting for so long, waving their voting cards like placards for overthrowing dictatorship and the Lee regime.
					
					 All the young people should not be taken in by the deceptive trick of the "Saenuri Party" but turn out in the election to demonstrate the firm will of themselves and other people to sternly punish the group of traitors.
					
					 You young people have an important duty to distinguish between war and peace, democracy and dictatorship and patriotism and treachery and decide future.
					
					 It is our firm belief that the south Korean youth and students will certainly inflict a heavy defeat upon the conservative regime and the "Saenuri Party" in the forthcoming election and give further momentum to the movement for independence and democracy in south Korean society and the strong trend in the June 15 era of reunification as required by the expectation and desire of the whole nation.

articles.title: National Photo Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Photo Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A national photo exhibition opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday to celebrate the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 On display at the venue are more than 400 photos including those of the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Such photos as "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung in his early years" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung at time of training communists of new generation while shaping the line of Juche for the Korean revolution" deal with his greatness. 
					
					 Some photos show army building exploits as well as the brilliant life, noble virtues and popular traits of the President who devoted his tireless efforts to the prosperity and the cause of independent and peaceful reunification of the country and global independence. 
					
					 Among the photos are "The respected leader Comrade Kim Il Sung and the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il give field guidance to the West Sea Barrage" and "The respected leader Comrade Kim Il Sung and the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il visit Mangyongdae Fun Fair". They show the leadership exploits of the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 The visitors will see photos dealing with the firm resolution of the DPRK people to dynamically push forward the great advance for prosperity of a thriving nation, united close around the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, made an opening address.

articles.title: Korean Stamp Museum, Korean Stamp Exhibition Opened
articles.content:
Korean Stamp Museum, Korean Stamp Exhibition Opened
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Korean Stamp Museum was opened on April 9 with due ceremony on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display in the museum standing in the heart of the capital city are data on the revolutionary leadership provided by the three commanders of Mt. Paektu over the issue of stamps and those on various themes. Also displayed in a chronological order and according to contents are stamps and data on relics which comprehensively deal with the history of the development of stamps from the period of Ri Dynasty. Among them are stamp "Althea" and "Samson Rocks," the first variety of stamps issued in liberated Korea.
					
					 The Korean Stamp Exhibition was opened at the museum on the same day.
					
					 Seen in the venue were portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il and photos of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un enlarged from stamps. 
					
					 The museum showcases stamps dealing with the revolutionary history of the President such as "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung proclaiming the birth of the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung including a writing brush in our party emblem" and "The founding of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, our glorious motherland."
					
					 On display at the exhibition according to themes are stamps dealing with the immortal feats of Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk who devoted their whole lives to the prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation, the country's reunification and global independence.
					
					 Among the stamps are diverse stamps contributed by philatelists.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Delegates and Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Delegates and Guests Here 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of different regions and countries and foreign guests arrived here on Monday to participate in the World Congress on Juche Idea.
					 They included Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party, a delegation of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea led by Director-General Harish Gupta, a delegation of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea headed by Director General Edmond Jouve, a researchers' group of the International Institute of the Juche Idea led by Director Takao Kamakura, Secretary General Matteo Carbonelli and Deputy Director-General Bruno Amoroso of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, a delegation of the Japanese Society for Studying Kimilsungism headed by Keizo Sumiya, chairman of the Society for Supporting Korean Schools in Fukuoka Prefecture, a delegation of the Japanese National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea led by President Seiichi Sakugawa, a delegation of the Mongolian Association for the Study of Juche Idea-Songun led by its executive chairman, a delegation of the Ban
					
					 gladesh Institute of the Juche Idea led by Chairman M. Gamrul Huda, a delegation of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea led by Chairman Nikolai Polishk, a delegation of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea headed by Chairman Nigatu Dagnachew Cherinet, a delegation of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, a delegation of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea led by Chairman Ivan Draksler, a delegation of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy led by Chairman Dermot Hudson, a delegation of the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea led by Aleksandr Neves Rosendo da Silva, a delegation of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand led by Chairman Songchit Pullarp, a delegation of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia led by President Jairo Gonzalez Trujillo, a delegation of the Group for the Study of the J
					
					 uche Idea of Kyrgyzstan led by Chief Anarbek Usupbaev, a delegation of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea led by Chief Jean Marie Lambret, a South African delegation for studying the Juche idea led by Garth Lawrence Shelton, a delegation of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Poland led by Roman Orlowski, a delegation for studying the Juche idea of Slovenia led by Igor Jurisic, Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, a delegation of the Ecuadorian Cultural Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea led by Chairman Milton Burbano Borquez, Mohammad Aslam Nagi, chairman of the Pakistani Committee for Studying Kimilsungism, Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il 's Works, Garib Newaz, chairman of the Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre, Francisco Davila Bale, chairman of the Costa Rican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, 
					
					 Francis F. Lyimo, chairman of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups, Rohekele Andre, vice-chairman of the National Coordinating Committee of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of the Working Citizens’ Association of Democratic Congo, David Cuschieri, general secretary of the Group for the Study of Juche Philosophy and Songun Politics of Malta, Samir Diyab, chairman of the Lebanese Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, Saber Ballul, head of Department of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus of Syria, Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, Thomas Losh, chief of the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Leos Sedlacek, chairman of the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea, and Adamos Katsantonis, chairman of the Cyprus Famagusta Musicians' Association, and his party, Shafqat Ullah, delegate of the Pakistani Organization 
					
					 for the Study of the Juche Idea, and David Anibal Jimenes Sardon, Peruvian delegate for studying the Juche idea. 
					
					 Arriving here on the same day were Ahmed Tidjani Cisse, minister of Cultural Heritage of Guinea, and his party, Hyuha Samali Dorothy, deputy secretary general of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, and his party, Ashanti Regional Secretary Joseph Yammin, representative of the National Democratic Congress of Ghana, Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, and his party, a delegation of the Socialist Party of Romania led by Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council, a delegation of the Czechoslovak Communist Party headed by Josef Servista, secretary of its Central Committee, Torsten Schoevitz, vice-chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, and a delegation of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil led by Vice-President Rosanita Campos and Dimitris Palmyris, president of the World Federation of Democratic Youth.

articles.title: Delegations, Delegates, Art Troupes, Acrobatic Groups of Different Countries Here
articles.content:
Delegations, Delegates, Art Troupes, Acrobatic Groups of Different Countries Here
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of different countries arrived here Monday to participate in the international festival marking the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included Bonakele Majuba, secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party and chairman of the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People, a delegation of the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association led by its chairman Thomas Reicherdt, Ludmila Levkova, chief of the Russia-Korea Children's Friendship Association Named after Kim Jong Il and principal of 11th Middle School in Khabarovsk City, Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Democratic Congo and chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, a delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association headed by Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, Alexandr Brezhnev, writer and poet of the Russian Union of Writers, and his party,.
					
					 Arriving here earlier were Irina Malenko, Irish delegate for friendship, and a delegation of the French preparatory committee for celebrating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung headed by Benua Tenedei, vice-chairman of the France-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 Arriving here on Monday to participate in the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival were the Indonesian government cultural delegation headed by I Gusti Puta Laksaguna, inspector general of the Ministry of Tourism and Creative Economy, the Chinese art group (the Song and Dance Ensemble of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army), a Chinese acrobatic group, the Malaysia My Harmonica World Ensemble, the Surya Chorus of Indonesia and the Chamber Orchestra Alberic Magnard of France.
					
					 Departing here on the same day was the delegation of diplomatic officials of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Major General Qian Lihua, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense.

articles.title: Women's Grand Performance Marks Day of Sun
articles.content:
Women's Grand Performance Marks Day of Sun 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A grand chorus "Fatherly leader and women" was given by members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) at the plaza of the April 25 House of Culture on Monday in celebration of the Day of the Sun.
					 The chorus brought together 10000 DWUK members selected from various districts of Pyongyang.
					
					 The chorus began with an ode and chorus "Let us sing of the Day of the Sun". Singing "Our leader" and "With a Single Heart" the women looked up to the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il lie in state in their lifetimes.
					
					 In poem and chorus "Boundless Is Yearning", series of choruses "The Leader Will Always Be with Us" and "General Lives as Sun", the singers truthfully portrayed the life of patriotic devotion of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In kayagum ensemble and chorus "Ninani Nanno of Happiness", guitar ensemble and chorus "Family Happiness Is Source of Every Success" the performers sang of the pride and self-esteem of the Korean women leading a happy life. 
					
					 In choral recitation of poem "Eternal Song of Women of Sun's Korea", dance and song "We will safeguard General Kim Jong Un at the cost of lives" they reflected the faith and will of the Korean women to uphold the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un with loyalty.

articles.title: Traditional Korean Costumes Characterized by Elegant Figures
articles.content:
Traditional Korean Costumes Characterized by Elegant Figures
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- More women in the capital city of Pyongyang choose traditional Korean costumes to wear in this spring season.
					 Women in the costumes become attraction for their colorful figures.
					
					 In this regard, KCNA met Jong Song Ho, a room chief of the Folklore Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 He said:
					
					 Figures of the costumes trace back to the ancient times.
					
					 In the period from the ancient times to the middle ages, the figure of Korean costumes became diverse, including geometry, nature, plant, animal and letter patterns.
					
					 Plant figures were most popular among them.
					
					 Prominence was given to their patterns in harmony with ground color.
					
					 The plant figures are considered a national heritage.

articles.title: Remembrance Meeting of Agricultural Workers Held
articles.content:
Remembrance Meeting of Agricultural Workers Held
Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting of agricultural workers took place in front of Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum on Monday on the theme "The leader is still among peasants" to observe the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, said that the agricultural workers could never forget the great dedication made by the President, who walked along lanes across fields for the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people till the last moments of his great revolutionary life. 
					
					  The floor was taken then by Ho Dok Bok, chairwoman of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers, and Hyon Ung Sil, chairwoman of the Tokchon City Cooperative Farm Management Committee.
					
					 They recollected with deep emotion the period in which they grew up to be proud officials of the country in the embrace of the President.
					
					  Ri Sin Ja, advisory chairwoman of the Pyongyang City Rural Economy Committee, and Kim Yong Suk, vice-minister of Agriculture, spoke of the personality of the President as a great man.
					
					 Jin Yon Sil, head of the fourth sub-workteam of Hero Ri Chang Son Workteam in the Ohyon Cooperative Farm, Yonan County, South Hwanghae Province, said that the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another great man, put forward her husband who sacrificed himself saving farmers as the hero of the Republic, saying that his deed is a beautiful one only human beings in our era can do.
					
					 Presented there were poems and songs lauding the President.

articles.title: Letter from Participants in IAAF 2012-25th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon
articles.content:
Letter from Participants in IAAF 2012-25th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a letter on Sunday from Dewald Stayn, South African Athletes Representative, Chang Rong, a team leader of the China Athletics Delegation, Wang Ching Cheng, general secretary of the Chinese Taipei Athletics Association, and Guenter Vogl, German Athletics Representative, on behalf of the participants in the IAAF 2012-the 25th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon.
					 The letter said:
					
					 It is a great honor and pleasure for us to participate in this event which is organized to celebrate the centenary of birth of the Great Leader President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 We are aware that the last year was the saddest day for the Korean people as they lost their Great Leader General Kim Jong Il so suddenly and so unexpectedly.
					
					 The exploits made by Kim Jong Il for the prosperity and happiness of the Korean people will last forever and he will always be with us.
					
					 We wish Korean people a great success in building strong and powerful nation, concluded the letter.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Tudan Duck Farm
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Tudan Duck Farm
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here visited the Tudan Duck Farm in Pyongyang on Monday.
					 The guests looked round duck houses, open-air ground for duck, production base of ferment food and animal protein food and other places of the farm, being briefed on the fact that the factory was successfully rebuilt.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Korean Children's Association in Jilin
articles.content:
Korean Children's Association in Jilin
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- April 10 marks the 85th anniversary of the Korean Children's Association formed by President Kim Il Sung in Jilin.
					 Setting out on the road of the revolution in his early years, the President formed the Saenal Children's Union in Fusong of China before moving to Jilin at the beginning of Juche 16 (1927).
					
					 At that time, a number of young people aspiring to the new and the truth were gathering there.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung convened a meeting in March that year, at which he stressed the need to form a legitimate organization of youth and children and indicated tasks and ways for its formation and the name of it. Then, on the basis of full preparations he organized the Korean Children's Association in Jilin. 
					
					 The Association was aimed to educate boys and girls in the anti-Japanese idea and train them to be reliable reserves of the revolution, and its immediate task was to study fresh, advanced idea and introduce it among the broad masses.
					
					 The Association consisted of various sections for organizational affairs, publicity, culture and sports and other affairs and had its branches at schools and in areas.
					
					 Its experience and achievements served as a precious treasure and asset for the movement of young people in Korea.

articles.title: Tree Planting Gains Momentum in DPRK
articles.content:
Tree Planting Gains Momentum in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A tree-planting drive is gaining momentum in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea in the spring season.
					 The capital city of Pyongyang presses ahead with forestation, under a plan to plant Changsong Korea larch and pine-nut trees in 1,000 hectares of hills and mountains in the period.
					
					 Mangyongdae and Sunan districts are working to build forests mixed with broadleaf and needle-leaf trees.
					
					 Pothonggang and Tongdaewon districts have planted a variety of trees of good species in streets and pleasure grounds.
					
					 North Phyongan Province is paying efforts to increasing the rate of rooting by transplanting sample trees in time.
					
					 South Hamgyong Province has already planted hundreds of thousands of trees along railways extending more than 150 kilometers.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province has worked hard to forest its mountains.
					
					Yangdok County is taking the lead in afforestation in South Phyongan Province.

articles.title: Int'l Festival to Be Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Int'l Festival to Be Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- An international festival will take place in Pyongyang to mark President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary (April 15).
					 An official of the DPRK preparatory committee for the festival, Choe Jong Hun, told KCNA in this regard:
					
					 The festival is to be held from April 11 to 16. Attending it will be some 350 people from 60 odd countries, including representatives of the international preparatory committee, regional and national preparatory committees, those who were received by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, or their descendants, dignitaries and members of organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and international organizations.
					
					 The festival will cover colorful events -- visit to Kim Il Sung's old home in Mangyongdae, a memorial tree planting, visit to Kim Jong Il's native home in the Paektusan secret camp, an international joint celebration meeting, etc.
					
					 Every possible convenience will be provided to the arrivals on a high level.
					
					 Prizes and diplomas have been prepared for a book exhibition, an art works exhibition and an international prize contest for literary and art works. 
					
					 The festival will be greatly conducive to significantly marking the anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il, Songun Commander
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il, Songun Commander
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 19th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 On this occasion, the army and people of the DPRK recollect those days when Kim Jong Il were leading the Korean revolution with Songun (military-first) politics.
					
					 In the 1990s, he defined the politics as a principal mode of socialist politics and applied it to all fields of revolution and construction, ushering in a new era of the Juche-oriented revolution, the Songun era.
					
					With the politics, he had won victories one after another in standoff with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 On the basis of the principle that the army represents the party, the state and the people, he had strengthened the Korean People's Army into an invincible one.
					
					 With big efforts channeled to defence industry, he made it sure that the country was capable of manufacturing any kinds of latest weaponry and consolidated the modernization of the army, arming of the entire nation and fortifying of the whole country.
					
					 He had successfully turned the DPRK into a military power and a nuclear nation, while realizing the harmony between the army and the people.
					
					 By dint of the politics, he provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, the keynote of which is to achieve the independent reunification of the Korean Peninsula by the Koreans themselves, and upgraded the country's prestige.

articles.title: Exhibition of Consumer Goods under Way in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Exhibition of Consumer Goods under Way in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of consumer goods is going on here, with the approach of President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary.
					 The exhibits mainly include garments, furniture, processed marine products and foodstuffs from factories affiliated with national institutions like Kyonghung and Taehung guidance bureaus.
					
					 A wing of the Pyongyang Taehung Fur Factory draws the interest of visitors, with fur coats, gloves and shoes.
					
					 The Korea Jangsu Trading Corporation presented a variety of tonics made with Koryo ginseng cultivated in Kaesong area and other medicinal herbs.
					
					The exhibition will help improve the standard of living.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (23)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (23)
　　　Kim Il Sung Advances DFRK Founding Proposal for Korea's Reunification
					
					 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung performed great feats for Korea's reunification with his distinguished idea and leadership. 
					
					 It was in October Juche 68 (1979) that the Yushin (Revitalizing Reforms) system came to a tragic end in south Korea, causing great disorder.
					
					Under this situation, the President set forth the most reasonable and realistic proposal for national reunification and opened up a new phase of the nation-wide reunification movement. 
					
					 Saying it was high time that the north and the south of Korea pooled their efforts to grope an effective way for its independent and peaceful reunification, he suggested that an editorial of DPRK's newspaper Rodong Sinmun be made public to call for independent reunification through collaboration and unity, not confrontation.
					
					 At the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, he advanced the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK), stressing that the shortest and surest way for national reunification is to draw the north and the south together into a federal state, leaving the ideas and social systems existing in the north and the south as they are. 
					
					He attached top priority to identity of the homogenous Korean nation with history of 5 000 years, regarding it as a main factor for achieving reconciliation and unity between the north and the south with different ideas and social systems.
					
					 Then he energetically encouraged all Koreans to turn out in the nation-wide drive for carrying the proposal into practice. 
					
					 In November 1980 the President saw to it that all the political parties and social organizations in the north held a joint conference to propose setting up a preparatory committee for founding the DFRK, a consultative organization common to the nation consisting of representatives of different social strata at home and abroad. 
					
					 In August 1981 he advised that a joint statement of all the political parties and social organizations in the north should be announced to propose the convocation of a conference for promoting national reunification, which would be made up of representatives of the parties and organizations in the north and the south of Korea and representatives of overseas compatriots and jointly seek a way for founding a federal state. 
					
					 He also recommended convening a 100-people joint conference grouping celebrated politicians in the north and the south and abroad in next February and having north-south high-level political and military talks as an immediate measure for Korea's peace and peaceful reunification in December 1986. 
					
					 His wise leadership brought to naught the separatists' attempt for single channel in negotiations, flinging the door for dialogue between the north and the south wide open.
					
					 Encouraged by such measures, south Koreans of different social strata turned out in the movement for founding a federal state.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Glorifying Exploits in Building Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Glorifying Exploits in Building Thriving Nation
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates an editorial to the 19th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission. 
					 The editorial calls for steadily glorifying Kim Jong Il's idea of building a thriving nation and exploits, regarding them as the lifeline of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as a basic political mode under socialism for the first time in history and made a history of building an invincible thriving nation, the history of dramatically augmenting the nation's overall power on the basis of powerful military muscle, it says, and goes on:
					
					 Under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the dignity and might of the DPRK have been fully demonstrated in all aspects and the DPRK greeted a golden age of prosperity. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have the transparent spirit of deeply trusting in and following the leader, the indomitable will to steadfastly advance along the way of socialism despite the imperialist moves to stifle it and the strong guts and mettle to build a thriving nation of Juche on this land by their own efforts. This is the politico-ideological might of the army and people grown up under the care of Kim Jong Il and the biggest wealth of the country. 
					
					 Thanks to Kim Jong Il, the DPRK could demonstrate its might as invincible military power with powerful war deterrence capable of defeating any formidable enemy of imperialism at a single strike. 
					
					 The future of national prosperity is guaranteed and the country's dignity and honor are exalted by science and technology. This is the great pride of the country and the nation provided by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il put the DPRK on the position of invincible politico-military power and a scientific and technological power, firmly taking the Songun politics as a treasured sword. This exploit will always go down in the history of the thriving country.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Slammed for Escalating Confrontation with Compatriots
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Slammed for Escalating Confrontation with Compatriots 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- In a recent "election" campaign, Park Geun Hye was busy with a coloring offensive, pulling up the DPRK. She labeled opposition forces as "pro-north leftist forces" and cried out for preventing "those forces following the north" from coming to power. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					  It is right to say that every serpent has its venom and the blood running in the vein of a dictator can never change.  
					
					 She supported the June 15 joint declaration and talked about reconciliation and cooperation during her visit to Pyongyang in 2002. But what she is doing now is self-exposing that she is diehard anti-DPRK confrontation maniac opposed to the improved inter-Korean relations and the country’s reunification.
					
					 Her true colors as a confrontation maniac and viper-like temperament were brought to light late last year when she turned down a proposal of opposition parties to dispatch a mourners group of the "National Assembly" to the north after the great loss to the nation.
					
					 Decades have passed since the end of "yusin" dictatorship in south Korea, but the people are not yet awake from the nightmare at that time. 
					
					 It is clear from what Park has done so far that she, obsessed with sycophancy towards the U.S., treachery and fascist rule, will follow in the footsteps of the "yusin" dictator who turned south Korea into tundra of democracy and human rights and frantically pursued the north-south confrontation and a war against the north, 
					
					 No matter how hard Park may try to disguise herself with veils of  "change" and "revamping", letting loose such rhetoric as "she would break with the past wrongs" and advance toward future, she can never hide her true colors as a politician who inherited the bloodline of confrontation maniac.
					
					 It is deplorable that the descendant of "the yusin" dictator is working hard to gratify her greed for power in south Korea.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Japan's Bad Habit of Slandering Others
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Japan's Bad Habit of Slandering Others
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Japanese Prime Minister Noda in his speech at a graduation ceremony of the Defence Academy of Japan talked about the need for the "Self-Defence Forces" to take "necessary counteractions" against the DPRK and China, claiming that they are creating security uneasiness, says Minju Joson Monday in a by-lined commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is needless to say that Japan's claim that "security uneasiness" was created by the DPRK and China is nothing but a far-fetched assertion.
					
					 Lurking behind the accusation made the Japanese prime minister, directly mentioning the DPRK and China, is a sinister aim sought by him. 
					
					 Japan is keen to turn itself into a military power and realize its  ambition for its militarist overseas expansion.
					
					 What Japan requires is a justification for achieving the above-said two goals. It seeks ways of doing so in zealously following the U.S. strategy towards Asia and pulling up its neighboring countries.
					
					 Like a drowning man trying to catch even a straw, Japan has gone the lengths of finding fault with the DPRK's planned launch of satellite for peaceful purposes though it is its legitimate right. It is a crafty calculation of Japan to secure a justification for achieving the  two goals and dodge the international community's criticism by labeling the normal activities of sovereign states as "illegal," come what may.  
					
					 Such poor trick of Japan can never work now.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to give up at once its criminal scenario to bring Asia a war disaster again and opt for genuine peace. It should drop its bad habit to draw water to its mill by pulling up others.

articles.title: American Students Saddled with Huge Debts
articles.content:
American Students Saddled with Huge Debts 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- University students in the U.S. are now saddled with huge debts, spawning a serious problem.  
					 A recent report of the U.S. Board of Governors of Federal Reserve System said the amount of debts American students have to pay went beyond a trillion U.S. dollars or a 25 pct increase over that a decade ago.

articles.title: Iran Warns U.S. against Deploying MD
articles.content:
Iran Warns U.S. against Deploying MD 
 Tehran, April 8 (KCNA) -- The minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran on April 6 warned the U.S. against deploying a missile defense system (MD) in the region of the Persian Gulf.
					 He said the U.S. moves would only result in bigger instability in the region.
					
					 Noting the Iranian government has resolutely rejected such U.S. attempts, he appealed to the countries of the Persian Gulf not to take part in the MD plan backed by the U.S. and Zionist regime.

articles.title: Turkey Condemns Renewed Settlement Activity in East Jerusalem
articles.content:
Turkey Condemns Renewed Settlement Activity in East Jerusalem
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- "We strongly condemn the Israeli government for adding to its settlement activities in occupied Palestinian lands by opening tenders for more than 800 additional (housing) units," Turkey's Foreign Ministry said in a statement on Friday.
					 Turkish foreign ministry accused Israel of openly violating  international law by going ahead with its settlement activities adding such activities block efforts to revive the peace process in Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- China signed a memorandum of understanding with Angola on April 5 for further development of judicial cooperation between two countries.
					 On the same day Russia agreed with Kyrgyzstan to eliminate inconveniences at the borders.

articles.title: Works Published in Indonesia, Switzerland
articles.content:
Works Published in Indonesia, Switzerland 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's works "For the Complete Victory of Socialism" and "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation For the Reunification of the Country" were brought out in pamphlet by the Hekadaha Printing and Publishing House of Indonesia and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea respectively.
					 The work "For the Complete Victory of Socialism", published on December 30, 1986, clarifies the historic necessity of the complete victory of socialism and the basic issue arising in achieving the complete victory of socialism and its reason.
					
					 It also underscores the need to dynamically push ahead with the socialist economic construction, strengthen the people's power and increase its function and role, and the urgency of national reunification and ways to achieve it.
					
					 The work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation For the Reunification of the Country" was published on April 6, 1993. It includes the issue of founding a unified state through the great unity of the whole nation and achieving unity based on patriotism and the spirit of national independence, the issue of promoting co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests and ending all political disputes that foment division and confrontation between fellow countrymen, the need for the north and the south to trust and unite with each other and the issue of joining hands on the road of national reunification, not rejecting each other because of differing ism.

articles.title: Reminiscences of Kim Il Sung Carried by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Reminiscences of Kim Il Sung Carried by Nepali Paper 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- "Last Image" of Chapter 6 of Vol. 2 and "Ri Gwang" and "Immortal Flower" of Chapter 8 of Vol. 3 of Part 1 Anti-Japanese Revolution of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" were serialized from March 29 to April 2 by the organ of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party Majodur.
					 The paper carried a portrait of the President and photos of indomitable revolutionary fighters Kang Pan Sok and Kim Chol Ju.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the feats of President Kim Il Sung took place in Benin, Italy and Democratic Congo and joint meetings in South Africa, Denmark and Norway between March 26 and 31 on the occasion of the centenary of his birth.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and General Kim Jong Il's Works, at the seminar said that the President ushered in a new era of Juche Korea with his profound ideas and theories and gigantic revolutionary practices and performed undying feats which will always go down in the history of the struggle for human liberation, possessed of gifted intelligence, outstanding leadership ability and noble virtues.
					
					 Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, lauded the President's life as a history of the legendary great man who saved and protected the destiny of the country and the nation. He is boundlessly revered by the world progressive people, the secretary general added.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark－DPRK Friendship Association, noted that the modern history of Korea would have been unthinkable without the President. 
					
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, said that the President was, indeed, a peerlessly great man and the sun of mankind to whom all people look up and praise.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President was perfectly carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il and is now being inherited and carried to completion by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the chairman added.

articles.title: Juche Idea Study Group Formed in Norway
articles.content:
Juche Idea Study Group Formed in Norway
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Ostfold Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Norway was formed with due ceremony on March 31.
					 Present at the ceremony were officials and members of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway and the Friendship Society Norway-Korea.
					
					 Rita Berger was elected chief of the group.
					
					 The ceremony stressed the need to intensify the activities for studying and disseminating the Juche idea and express invariable support for the Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Special Write-ups Posted on Foreign Websites to Mark Day of Sun
articles.content:
Special Write-ups Posted on Foreign Websites to Mark Day of Sun
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups were posted on Internet homepages of Venezuela, Brazil and Romania on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun.
					 An Internet homepage of Venezuela on March 23 said:
					
					 This is a significant year marking the centenary of the birth of the President, the founder of the Juche idea, the distinguished strategist of the struggle for national liberation and the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 The Korean people are advancing with great hope for the future, overcoming all difficulties.
					
					 General secretary Kim Jong Il firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country with Songun by inheriting the cause of the sun.
					
					 The Korean people will always glorify the undying feats of the great persons of Mt. Paektu, rallied close around the respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Brazilian Communist Party on March 29 posted on its Internet homepage several videos on the DPRK illustrated with a photo of the President standing together with the leader.
					
					 The Romanian Workers' Association on April 3 posted on its Internet homepage photos of the Korean people's effort for building a thriving nation and happy life and Korean songs accompanied with portraits and photos of the great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland Mangyongdae Committee for Celebrating the Centenary of the Birth of President Kim Il Sung, posted on Internet homepages of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Finland-Korea Society and the Jongilbong E-Library an article praising the feats of the President.

articles.title: Cambodian Media Laud Feats
articles.content:
Cambodian Media Laud Feats 
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Cambodian broadcasting service and news agency released commemorative reports between March 26 and April 3 on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Apsara TV and Radio said that the President performed undying feats for the liberation of the country, socialist construction, reunification of Korea and global independence.
					
					 His sacred revolutionary career, feats and noble virtues move many people of the world and make each of them deeply revere and follow him, it said, and continued:
					
					 Grand celebrations are taking place worldwide in the run-up to the centenary of his birth.
					
					 State Radio reported that he made every possible effort to reunify Korea.
					
					 A bright prospect was opened for Korea's reunification thanks to Kim Il Sung, the radio noted. He is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people and progressive mankind and his feats will shine forever.
					
					  F.M. 90.5 Radio aired a similar program.
					
					 Another radio and AKP News Agency noted that the DPRK turned into a powerful socialist state, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence, in a short span of time under the wise leadership of the President.
					
					 The DPRK could invariably uphold the banner of socialism and make a leap forward to a high eminence of a thriving socialist nation thanks to the powerful foundation and potentials provided by the President, the news agency stressed.

articles.title: Seminar on Works Held in Switzerland
articles.content:
Seminar on Works Held in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A seminar on general secretary Kim Jong Il's works "On the Juche Idea" and "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was held in Switzerland on March 31.
					 A reporter and speakers including Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il published the work "On the Juche Idea" which scientifically and comprehensively systematizes the revolutionary ideas of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The progressives the world over unanimously long for Korean socialism in which the Juche idea has been successfully embodied, they noted.
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed the idea and line of the President on attaching importance to military affairs, they noted, adding that the leader pursued Songun politics which calls for pushing forward both the defence of the country and socialist construction with the army as a main force and pillar of the revolution.
					
					 The Korean people are now dynamically advancing along the road of the Songun revolution without the slightest deviation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, they said.
					
					 The chairman of the group stressed the need to intensify the activities for studying and disseminating the Juche idea and the Songun idea and positively support the Korean people in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Otorgada a Kim Jong Il la Orden Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Otorgada a Kim Jong Il la Orden Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, 9 de abril (ACNC) --  Segun el decreto fechado 29 de marzo del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fue otorgada al Dirigente Kim Jong Il la Orden Kim Il Sung con motivo del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					 El decreto senala que en reflejo de la voluntad y deseo unanimes de todo el ejercito y el pueblo otorgan la Orden Kim Il Sung al Dirigente quien al llevar adelante la causa revolucionaria del Juche, hizo brillar con victorias y glorias la historia de 100 anos de la nacion del Sol y asento el eterno cimiento para la prosperidad de Corea del Songun.

articles.title: Otorgado Premio Kim Il Sung a Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Otorgado Premio Kim Il Sung a Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, 9 de abril (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto fechado 29 de marzo del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fue otorgado el Premio Kim Il Sung al Dirigente Kim Jong Il con motivo del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					 El documento senala que en reflejo de la voluntad y deseo unanimes de todo el ejercito y el pueblo otorgan el Premio Kim Il Sung al Dirigente quien con la idea y teoria enciclopedicas aclaro el camino a seguir por la revolucion coreana y la epoca y preparo la era dorada en la construccion de cultura socialista de Corea del Songun.

articles.title: En Pyongyang delegados a la Conferencia del PTC
articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegados a la Conferencia del PTC
 Pyongyang, 9 de abril (ACNC) -- Arribaron este lunes a esta capital los delegados a la IV Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					 Los recibieron en la estacion ferroviaria de Pyongyang los funcionarios del comite preparatorio de la Conferencia.

articles.title: Inaugurada exhibicion central de fotos
articles.content:
Inaugurada exhibicion central de fotos
 Pyongyang, 9 de abril (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la exhibicion central de fotos en celebracion del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					 Estan expuestas mas de 400 fotos incluyendo las alusivas a la vida revolucionaria del Presidente tales como "El gran Lider, camarada  Kim Il Sung en su ninez" y "El gran Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung en el periodo en que formaba a los comunistas de nueva generacion madurando la autoctona linea de la revolucion coreana".
					
					 Las fotos dan a conocer las hazanas realizadas para la construccion del ejercito y la brillante vida, la noble virtud y los rasgos populares del Presidente quien dedico su incansable abnegacion para la prosperidad de la patria, la reunificacion independiente y pacifica y la verificacion de la causa de la independencia en el mundo.
					
					 Tambien se ven otras fotos como "El estimado Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung y el gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il dirigiendo en el terreno la construccion del Complejo Hidraulico del Mar Oeste" y "El estimado Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung y el gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il visitando parque de atracciones Mangyongdae" que transmiten las hazanas de orientacion de los grandes hombres del monte Paektu, y otras alusivas a la ferrea determinacion de militares y civiles de acelerar la marcha del gran auge uniendose monoliticamente en torno al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Tuvo lugar el dia 9 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la ceremonia inaugural.
					
					 El discurso de apertura estuvo a cargo de Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC.
